warehouse_overview.name: Berry Hill ITAD Warehouse
warehouse_overview.mission: Erase, diagnose, grade, and refurbish IT equipment received from customers

workflow.name: IA (Inventory Administration) Team
workflow.description: Starting point in warehouse workflow. Books in all incoming equipment.

details.scope: Books in all data-bearing and non-data-bearing equipment
process: Open totes/boxes from customer shipments
Take pictures of contents
Separate data-bearing devices from non-data-bearing items
Separate cables, cardboard, and other rubbish
Tag data-bearing devices with RFID containing unique stock ID and device serial number
Label non-data-bearing tracked items (e.g., ID cards) with regular labels
Send tagged devices down the roller to engineers

workflow.name: Engineering Team
workflow.description: Erases and diagnoses devices received from IA team.

process: Receive devices from IA via roller
Perform data erasure procedures (varies by device type)
Run hardware diagnostics
Document findings
Pass devices to QA team for grading

workflow.name: QA (Quality Assurance) Team
workflow.description: Grades devices and assigns final destination.

details.scope: Inspect, grade, and assign device destinations

destinations.name: Resale
destinations.description: Device meets quality standards for retail resale

destinations.name: Disposal
destinations.description: Device cannot be salvaged or repaired

destinations.name: Refurbish
destinations.description: Device needs cosmetic or functional refurbishment

destinations.name: Quarantine
destinations.description: Device flagged for investigation (e.g., failed erase, security concern)

destinations.name: Used Approved
destinations.description: Device approved for as-is sale as used equipment

workflow.name: Sorting Team
workflow.description: Packs devices onto trolleys and pallets for final destinations.

process: Receive QA-graded devices with destination assignments
Assign device to appropriate trolley or pallet based on destination
Prepare for shipping/internal movement to destination warehouse

laptop_desktop.name: Laptops/Desktops
process: 1. Load BIOS, remove password (ask QA team or check password cheat sheet if needed)
2. Turn off Secure Boot
3. Turn off Virtualization
4. Clear security chip
5. Save BIOS changes
6. Boot from USB or network to load Blancco
7. Blancco begins erasure while user performs diagnostics
8. Autopilot check runs simultaneously
9. Fill in report details
10. Verify erasure completion and autopilot status updated
11. Send report to QA

servers.name: Servers
process: 1. Load straight into Blancco (no diagnostics or autopilot check)
2. Erasure procedure only
3. Fill in mandatory report details: Lot/Sales Order Number, Asset/Stock ID, Engineer initials
4. Send report
5. After report: check server for asset tags or company names
6. Perform factory reset

networking.name: Networking Equipment
networking.method: Novafox Hydra or Manual Factory Reset
process: 1. For most items: use Novafox Hydra to perform factory reset (generates report)
2. Alternative: user manually performs factory reset if Novafox not available
3. Reference folder of networking reset procedures available for specific device models

mobiles_tablets.name: Mobiles/Tablets
process: 1. Blancco set up on standalone machines (not connected to online workflow)
2. Put device into Developer Mode
3. Blancco prompts for user details
4. Erasure performed
5. Factory reset executed
6. New OS installed
7. Device shows setup screen (unless remotely managed)

macs.name: Macs
process: 1. Mac must be M2 or better
2. BEAD agent puts Mac into DFU mode
3. Erasure performed in DFU mode
4. Once erasure complete, diagnostics run by accessing Setup Screen location
5. Open terminal: Option + Command + T
6. Use BEAD-associated USB to load diagnostics
7. Complete diagnostics and send report
macs.diagnostics: Yes - via terminal and BEAD USB

surfaces.name: Surfaces
process: 1. Follow Laptop/Desktop procedure
2. May require docking station to run procedure more easily
3. Otherwise same as Laptop/Desktop: BIOS password removal, boot Blancco, erasure + diagnostics + autopilot check

chromebooks.name: Chromebooks
chromebooks.method: Powerwash / Dev Mode + Remote Blancco Desktop
chromebooks.complexity: High - many staff struggle with this
process: METHOD 1 - Powerwash (if device allows):
a. Boot chromebook
b. Ctrl + Alt + Shift + R to open Powerwash prompt
c. Connect to network
d. Check if device is remotely managed
METHOD 2 - Recovery Mode to Dev Mode (if Powerwash unavailable):
a. Turn off device
b. Hold Power + Esc + Refresh to enter Recovery
c. Press Ctrl + D
d. Press Enter
e. Try Ctrl + D again to enter Dev Mode
f. If remotely managed: won't enter Dev Mode, just press Enter to return to normal
g. If Dev Mode successful: takes ~5 mins to transition
METHOD 3 - Remote Erasure (if Dev Mode gained):
a. Connect to WiFi or Ethernet after Dev Mode boots
b. Go to Guest Mode (opens web page)
c. Find desktop to connect to
d. Input IP address of Blancco-loaded desktop
e. Follow on-screen instructions for erasure and diagnostics
f. Input engineer details on desktop
g. Send report
chromebooks.note: Louis is experienced with chromebook procedures - consult if stuck

qa_grading.description: QA (Quality Assurance) grading system and process
qa_grading.grading_scale: A, B, C, D (D usually means disposal)
process: 1. Engineers use QA app tags that score device and generate grade
2. Any faults during procedure listed in engineer report
3. QA person reviews report and inspects physical device for damage
4. QA takes pictures if required for documentation
5. Based on engineer report and physical inspection, QA assigns destination:
- Resale: meets quality standards for retail resale
- Disposal: cannot be salvaged or repaired (usually Grade D)
- Breakfix: requires repair before resale
- Refurbish: needs cosmetic or functional refurbishment
- Quarantine: flagged for further investigation
- Used Approved: approved for as-is sale

quarantine_rules.description: When and why devices go to quarantine
quarantine_rules.primary_reason: Device locked and unable to be erased
triggers: Macs: multiple lock mechanisms (firmware lock, login password, T2/M-series lockdown)
Chromebooks: remote management lock, developer mode restrictions, firmware lock
Phones/Mobiles: activation lock, MDM enrollment, factory reset protection
Laptops/Desktops: BIOS locked - waiting on customer to provide password
Any device: customer initiates quarantine with instructions for later processing
process: 1. Device sent to quarantine if erasure cannot be completed
2. Engineer documents reason (locked status, missing password, etc.)
3. Device flagged in system for investigation
4. Contact customer for password, unlock permission, or MDM unenrollment
5. Once customer provides solution, device moves back to engineering workflow

chromebooks.issue: Chromebook procedures are complex and error-prone
chromebooks.details: Many staff struggle with chromebook erasure procedures. Requires understanding of Powerwash, Dev Mode, Recovery mode, and remote desktop connection. Takes extra training and practice.
chromebooks.expertise: Louis is experienced with chromebook procedures - consult if stuck

blancco_software.resolution: Contact Blancco support for technical issues

printer_issues_ia.resolution: Usually resolved by unplugging and replugging the printer

printer_driver_installation.issue: After installing Zebra printer drivers, initially the plugged-in printer doesn't work
printer_driver_installation.solution: Swap the printer with another working printer temporarily. The system will create a '(copy 1)' instance of the printer that resolves the issue.
printer_driver_installation.workaround: Known quirk with Zebra driver installation - physical swap is fastest fix

dell_legacy_master_password.description: Alternate path for older Dell systems with BIOS passwords
dell_legacy_master_password.when_to_use: Legacy Dell devices that show a challenge code on the BIOS password screen
process: 1. On the locked Dell BIOS screen, note the challenge code shown for password recovery
2. Go to Dell's BIOS recovery website (master password generator)
3. Enter the challenge code (and service tag if prompted)
4. The site returns a long one-time master password
5. Enter the provided password in BIOS to clear the existing BIOS password
6. After clearing, set a new password if required or leave blank per policy
notes: Requires network access to reach Dell's site
Applies to older/legacy Dell models that present a recovery code
Use only with proper authorization on customer-owned equipment

networking_reset_procedures.description: Comprehensive collection of networking device factory reset procedures from when processes were DIY. Covers various manufacturers and models. Use as reference when Novafox Hydra is unavailable or for specific device guidance.
networking_reset_procedures.usage: Consult for device-specific reset steps, alternatives to Novafox
